pros: Awesome staff, got to serve the community
cons: Everything was amazing until the owners decided it was too expensive to keep it open. The community lost a 150+ bed hospital that will no longer server them because the owners were too cheap.

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Stockton, CA
pros: Good bosses. Good staff. Nice work environment
cons: None that I can think of

job_title: Licensed Practical Nurse in Jacksonville, FL
pros:
Care partner program... where the nurse if partned with a CNA
I learned so much working here
cons: At times they were understaffed

pros: Great patient care at the hospital
cons: Only two days off, flexibility for more days off

review_title: The job pays well, but the workers are awful, especially Management
pros: Great pay and benefits for employees
cons: Management is terrible, they do nothing but always have something to critique. Other workers are rude and unhappy. Overall extremely toxic environment that does not promote community and respect amongst workers.

job_title: Registered Nurse in New York, NY
pros: Extremely community oriented hospital location
cons: Always worked short staffed , unfortunately

pros: Great advancement opportunities and tuition assistance offered
cons: Insurance benefits are too expensive and not very good coverage

job_title: Registered Nurse, Emergency Room in Bridgeport, CT
pros: The midlevel management in my particular department is stellar. In general, the staff around me are like-minded, helpful and competent, with the associated sense of irreverence that keeps the Emergency Department from sinking into insanity on stressful days.
cons: Owned by a very large Catholic health organization called Ascension Health. They are on a nickel and dime cost-saving push, but also on a mission to make all procedures and protocols consistent throughout their hospitals. They have a large portion of hospitals in the Midwest. Unfortunately a Northeastern hospital situated in a poor inner-city area takes some nuanced and unique changes to be successful.

pros: Great co-workers, benefits and experience
cons:
Shifts understaffed
Ran out of needed supplies constantly
Constant changes to protocol without adequate directions

job_title: Aquatic Fitness Instructor in Santa Barbara, CA
pros: The residents that I was able to work with were wonderful. I was brought in to develop an aquatic fitness program so I had the flexibility to utilize the input of the residents to devise an effective program that met their needs.
cons: Management did not take concerns from staff members seriously. In the aquatic facility there were safety concerns that directly put residents in harms way yet management was slow to approve work orders and were not quick to come up with solutions to the problems.

job_title: Group Home Manager in Stratford, CT
pros: Rewarding job ob giving and helping special needs clietns.
cons: Dealing with the staff of careworkers is the mos challenging.  They are basically incompetent for the most part and rather lazy which seems to be a common trait among many of the workers in this organization.  If you are a manager that likes to see things done right and hold your staff accountable you will have a hard time with this because upper management does not support group home mangers.

job_title: Emergency Department RN in Bridgeport, CT
pros: Location, Great staff.  It was wonderful to work with a team that I was proud of.
cons: Unfortunately, the hospital was not managed well from the top down, and employee satisfaction did not appear to be a concern.

job_title: Chief Research Associate in Fairfield, CT
pros: Great company to work with... Small, flexible, caring and great team of caregivers who put the patient at the top of the pyramid.
cons: Parking in the parking lot is always a challenge if you work here... Spaces are tight so if you don't want to get door dings in your car, it's gonna happen.

job_title: Third Party Payer Representative in Bridgeport, CT
pros: Great benefits, flexible work hours, laid back atmosphere. A lot of time to yourself and working completely independently. Room for growth.
cons: Job security, old and complicated systems and ways of completing tasks. Lots of turnover at the top. Not many modern incentives. Have to pay to park.

job_title: Emergency Room Technician in Bridgeport, CT
pros: Great, positive employee recognition with a manager that is always willing to help. Supportive staff available for team work/questions. Several different schedules to choose from if you are a working parent.
cons: Low compensation, you have to pay for parking, and patient wait times are very long in the waiting room and for results from testing.

job_title: RN Staff Nurse in Bridgeport, CT
pros: community hospital-small environment-easy to navigate around
cons: poor management-cost focused without consideration for the staff and patients that ultimately support the financial stability

review_title: Overall I liked working there, but it changed when new management came in.
pros: It was a very good learning environment, but it changed.
cons: They were interested in new grads rather than experienced workers.

pros: Work/life balance is great. Working environment can be stressful at time. But that is to be expected at any organization.
cons: To many changes with the take over of Ascension Health. Lost of job security. Not much room for advancement in your department.
